name: Queen's Gambit
description: One of the oldest and most respected openings. White offers a pawn to gain central control, though Black can hold the pawn only temporarily.

startingMoves.comment: The Queen's Gambit - offering the c-pawn

variations.name: Queen's Gambit Accepted
variations.description: Black accepts the pawn but must be careful not to hold onto it for too long.

moves.comment: Regaining the pawn with good development

variations.name: Queen's Gambit Declined
variations.description: The classical response - Black declines the pawn and maintains a solid position.

variations.name: Slav Defense
variations.description: Black supports d5 with c6 instead of e6, keeping the light-squared bishop active.

moves.comment: The Slav! Supporting d5 while keeping Bc8 free
Now taking is good - Bf5 is possible

variations.name: Semi-Slav Defense
variations.description: A hybrid of the Slav and QGD, combining c6 and e6. Very solid but the Bc8 is temporarily blocked.
